intro: Cleome cornus-africani, commonly known as African cleome, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a member of the Cleomaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy choice for gardens. Cleome cornus-africani is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care.
